author: forexbrokr
title: The link between Cub Finance (CUB) and LeoFinance (LEO)
body:
![The link between Cub Finance (CUB) and LeoFinance (LEO).](https://images.hive.blog/DQmVfCJT8okrEakpBgWAFsNqaMK2U1P7QTHmiwAi9ZD1k6w/the-link-betwee-cub-finance-cub-and-leofinance-leo.png)

---
## Discover the way in which Cub Finance (CUB) and LeoFinance (LEO) are forever linked. By now, there‚Äôs no doubt you‚Äôve heard that [Cub Finance](https://cubdefi.com/) is the sister project of [LeoFinance](https://leofinance.io/). While LeoFinance started as a web3 social media platform known as *Medium on the blockchain*, the overall project has grown into so much more. With a mission of continuously expanding the Hive community‚Äôs userbase and adding cross-chain value for its token holders, the move into BSC-based DeFi with Cub Finance was a logical next step. This section of our [Cub Finance (CUB) guide](https://leofinance.io/@crypto-guides/what-is-cub-finance-bsc-coin-cub) will discuss the role of each version of the LEO token and how to then easily wrap into bLEO for use on the platform.
![A Cub Finance (CUB) banner, showing off the logo of LeoFinance's sister project.](https://images.hive.blog/DQmaMLTDD4rYbqF4A4vjh1vDcxzxzdHV4WrCvZ2wctpfZx3/cub-finance-cub-simba-banner.png)
### The LeoFinance suite of tokens When it comes to tokens within the Cub and LeoFinance family, everything goes through the LEO token. #### The LEO token LEO is the native token of the entire LeoFinance ecosystem. Its distributed via a rewards pool system similar to HIVE and is used to pay users for publishing and curating quality content on leofinance.io. Natively a Hive layer-2 token with a home on the [Hive-Engine](https://leodex.io/market/LEO) exchange, LEO also acts as a bridge to other blockchains. #### The wLEO and bLEO tokens This bridge is achieved via wrapped tokens such wLEO to Ethereum and bLEO to Binance Smart Chain. Wrapped cryptocurrencies allow you to use tokens on blockchains to which they are not native. Thanks to wLEO and bLEO, members of Hive‚Äôs LeoFinance community are able to seamlessly cross to the Ethereum and BSC blockchains, taking advantage of external dApps such as DeFi platforms. #### The CUB token With a bridge to Binance Smart Chain completed by wrapping LEO into bLEO, this is where the Cub Finance DeFi application and CUB token come into play. Cub Finance allows Hive‚Äôs LeoFinance community to seamlessly access DeFi-based smart contracts on BSC, exchange tokens, provide liquidity and earn fees in return. All facilitated by the BEP20 CUB token used to enable use and reward liquidity providers. ### How to wrap LEO into bLEO to use on Cub Finance Wrapping LEO into bLEO allows you to move from the Hive blockchain based LEO, to the Binance Smart Chain based bLEO. Opening up LeoFinance community members to the exciting world of yield farming on the low-fee Binance Smart Chain. 1. Add bLEO as a custom token to MetaMask by clicking the ‚ÄúAdd Token‚Äù button and pasting the bLEO contract address (0x6421531af54c7b14ea805719035ebf1e3661c44a).
![Add bLEO as a custom token to MetaMask.](https://images.hive.blog/DQmXMh8XJybyg61SfF4K8FeVuUpg76rsAZhHJkes4M5TxUH/meta1.png)
2. Open the [gateway between LEO and BSC](https://wleo.io/bsc).
![Open the gateway between LEO and BSC.](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZyAYYmve1eVTSkovXo2XoDfCcUstA7dKQsUBDo29WDag/cub1.png)
3. Copy your BSC wallet address from MetaMask and paste it into the ‚ÄúLEO to bLEO‚Äù box.
![Copy your BSC wallet address from MetaMask.](https://images.hive.blog/DQmavd4p6XFogL5BDQTwLyWS9hsnpff59b1t3MnhohxYzXy/cub2.png)
4. Enter how much LEO you would like to deposit, remembering to allow for the 1 LEO gateway fee.
![Enter how much LEO you would like to deposit.](https://images.hive.blog/DQmerLA3Sw8vK4k13JjM8t4mSYRJTuN6BLmhvw9FXsTyyyn/cub3.png)
5. Confirm the Hive blockchain transaction via Hive Keychain and your tokens will be routed to your BSC wallet.
![Confirm the Hive blockchain transaction.](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdFnB7Mcr2mu6h46o9JU1RUJ9zJagpt1xchvKEWB5u9yo/cub4.png)
### Ultimately, everything is about the LEO token This section of our [guide to Cub Finance (CUB)](https://leofinance.io/@crypto-guides/what-is-cub-finance-bsc-coin-cub) has shown how the LEO token is central to facilitating the link between Cub Finance and LeoFinance. The Cub Finance platform has pushed LeoFinance closer to achieving its mission of expanding the Hive community‚Äôs userbase, while adding value to LEO token holders. In the end, everything is about the LEO token. Best of probabilities to you.
---
**Direct from the desk of Dane Williams.** *Why not leave a comment and share your thoughts on the link between Cub Finance (CUB) and LeoFinance (LEO), within the comments section below? All comments that add something to the discussion will be upvoted.* *This Cub Finance (CUB) blog is exclusive to [leofinance.io](https://leofinance.io/).* Posted Using [LeoFinance Beta](https://leofinance.io/@forexbrokr/the-link-between-cub-finance-cub-and-leofinance-leo)

author: dalz
title: Splinterlands Burned One Million HIVE In 2021 For Creating New Accounts | Data On Account Creation
body:
At the moment Hive accounts can be created with Resource Credits (RC) if the account has enough Hive Power to claim accounts, or they can be created by paying an account creation fee that at the moment is 3 HIVE. Creating accounts is the most expensive operation on the Hive blockchain in terms of RCs. 

A lot of Hive users have been claiming accounts as creation tokens, especially the larger HP holders. With millions HP some of the whale accounts were holding 50k, or 100k account creation tokens.  But when you have more then 10k new signups per day, those account creation tokens go away fast. 


![01.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmNrc4dLyyTjujfpgmRhStrU4pv4p3zBL2z3ZDYGMhLcJv/01.png)



Splinterlands have seen a massive growth and influx of new users. All of them need Hive accounts to play the game. Because of this the game has been creating around 10k Hive accounts per day in the last weeks. The account creation tokens were not enough to cover the demand and Splinterlands was simply paying the blockchain fee for creating accounts.

Here we will be looking at:
-	Number of overall accounts created
-	Accounts created for a fee and ‚Äúfree‚Äù accounts created with RC
-	Overall fees spent for creating accounts
-	Daily, monthly and yearly data

I decided to take a closer look into the account creation fees after my recent post on the [HIVE Suppy]( https://leofinance.io/@dalz/the-hive-supply-is-going-down-or-a-breakdown-of-the-hive-historical-supply), where I noted that I haven‚Äôt taken into account the fees for creating accounts. At the time I was thinking that this is a low number. @ausbitbank run some queries and pointed out in the comments that the overall HIVE spent for this is around 3M and just in 2021 it is around 1M. Thanks for him for this note, and I decided to have a closer look, since these numbers are not insignificant. 

# Hive Accounts Created 

Here is the chart for the all time Hive accounts created per day, starting from March 2016.


![image003.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZeSRhnZSJyfvWW1Z45ckaE6MUnrvtn3SmT29Ms1NrJFA/image003.png)


*The bluish color are accounts created for ‚Äúfree‚Äù with RC credits. The term free is not exactly correct since RCs were used for this and you need HP, but there was no fee paid in liquid HIVE, so we go with that term.*

As we can see here the first peak for new accounts was at the end of 2017 and the beginning of 2018 in the previous bull run. At that point there was more than 10k accounts created per day. Then a drop in the bear market and again a recent spike in the last few months, but this time more constant than before. At the moment of writing this there is almost **1.9M** Hive account in total. 

*Note on the account creation in the first years. At this time most of the accounts are created by the Steemit Inc accounts for a fee. We can see that in the chart. I‚Äôm not totally sure how the account creation worked at the time, but there was probably no option for creating accounts with RC credits.*

What interesting is that in the beginning the fee varied a lot, it was 100 HIVE in the very first days, then there is 10 and a 5 HIVE fees. At one point they are 0.5 HIVE. Later it would stabilize for a 3 HIVE fee that is now.

If take a look at the **monthly** chart we get this. 


![image003a.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmNPfSRxHGDskZWWdNbsFShxFRtUpudWpVeF7J1qZ7wJok/image003a.png)


*The last column for September is not over yet.*

August and September are record high in terms of account creation per month. August has 186k created and September is well over 200k now and it will reach somewhere in the range of **250k to 300k** new accounts. 

Compared with the previous period these numbers are well above when there was around 10k accounts created per month. 

### The yearly chart for new accounts looks like this. 


![image013.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmQXDy172VqXsi8HESQcqh52hTyXDrtfSEgPhA6bhxZzow/image013.png)


2018 is still the year with the most accounts created, **640k** but 2021 has a few months left and if the tempo for 100k to 200k accounts created per month continues there is a good possibility to be the ATH year for new accounts.

# Fees Spent For Creating Accounts

For better representation we will take a look at the monthly and yearly chart only. 
Here is the **monthly** chart. 
 

![image011.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmbKU7iti6EtWFi3eGnPvMNhKpaxr9DzZZ3xE1RRwNFvf9/image011.png)

*Again a note on the last column that represents September that is not over yet.*

Here we can see that in terms of fees the last two months have been a record high months. In August 2021 there is almost **500k** spent in fees for creating accounts and September is now at almost 600k and it will end well above that number.

In the past we can notice that the fees were highest in 2016 and the beginning of 2017 when in fact the number of new accounts was not that high, but simply the fee for new accounts was more expensive. There was a correction in the fee and when the bull run happened at the end of 2017 and the beginning of 2018 there is less fees spent on new accounts then in 2016. 

It should be noted that since Steemit Inc was creating the accounts this fees were coming from the tokens they already had (premine üòä), unlike now when Splinterlands is using their funds to cover for the account creation fees. 

The **yearly chart** for the new accounts fees looks like this.
 
![image015.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmSk5ykJcR9gNaAycZnPfabQDh2faRkzoNzNas3sZuN2Jc/image015.png)

The point from the above that in 2016 less accounts were created, but more fees used can be seen here clearly. Accounts creating fees were just more expensive then. I‚Äôm not totally sure but I think the fee for new account creation is set by the witnesses. 

2021 now has **1.1M** fees in HIVE for creating new accounts. Will see how it ends, but most likely it will surpass the 1.27M from 2016. Again, a note that the fees back then were all covered by Steemit Inc, while now Splinterlands is using their funds.

### Splinterlands Share In New Accounts Creation Fees
Just to point out the share of Splinterlands in the new accounts creation fees, here is the pie for 2021.

![image017.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmTfamrs778aiXYK2NXH5Jgm347JsnhaFvAoz4waSF39kG/image017.png)
 

99% of the fees for new accounts are paid by Splinterlands. 

The 3 HIVE fee is probably ok for the current price of HIVE, but if the price goes up, I guess it will need to be adjusted.


All the best
@dalz

Posted Using [LeoFinance <sup>Beta</sup>](https://leofinance.io/@dalz/splinterlands-burned-one-million-hive-in-2021-for-creating-new-accounts-or-data-on-account-creation)

author: leofinance
title: CUB V2 Migration Day Has Begun! | Tutorials, Impacts & More
body:
![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmenRjr7EVQG8KfyhYkhtiNXWhKjSUqZqycxJuKXuQRLDY/image.png)

The day has finally arrived! We've migrated our vaults, operations and interface to handle V2. Now it's time for CubFinance users to handle the migration on your end.

This entails migrating V1 to V2 liquidity **ONLY if you are in any of the 4 listed vaults** (note: CUB Kingdom and any other vault not listed here DOES NOT need to migrate):
- CUB-BUSD
- CUB-BNB
- bLEO-BNB
- DEC-BUSD

## V1 vs V2 Confusion:

![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZFujMgBxpGJ4nm8gyPjevZVM9FRuizNTQVEMfuXZvctZ/image.png)

Our team relies heavily on User Feedback for every aspect of the project. One of the most visible questions was about the links to add liquidity. We saw this issue first when we added CAKEPOP-BUSD - with users confused about whether to add liquidity on PCS or CubDeFi.

With this migration, we wanted to ensure this wasn't an issue. We've currently got a V2 AMM built but to avoid confusion, we're launching this migration **only with our old V1 AMM and then linking out to PancakeSwap for V2 liquidity**!

We believe this will make it easier for everyone to distinguish V1 from V2 during migration. Once the migration is over, we'll deprecate our old V1 UI altogether and then replace it with the new V2 UI.

By sending people to PancakeSwap for Migration to V2, we've made it much easier to understand:
- If you're adding or removing liquidity on **exchange.cubdefi.com**.. then you're **interacting with V1 liquidity only!**
- If you're adding or removing liquidity on **pancakeswap.finance**.. then you're **interacting with V2 liquidity only!**

## Again, for Clarity!

If you're removing liquidity from V1, then your UI should look like this:

![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmZSzbMnKKBWuFBhLTsp66STWCRss9tDgBe5TeDm7F15cD/image.png)

If you're adding liquidity to V2, then your UI should look like this:

![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmTV2qxcmJEtXBbVbbXhmYLS9gR7TfMH4qeXJgb6KQQnQm/image.png)

## How to Migrate from V1 to V2

We've released two guides so far showing you how to migrate liquidity from CUB V1 to CUB V2 Vaults.

The first is available on the CubFinance Docs: https://docs.cubdefi.com/how-to-migrate

The second is in our last post about the V2 migration: 
https://leofinance.io/@leofinance/cubfinance-v2-day-or-tutorial-on-the-v2-migration-rollout-schedules-and-0-deposit-fee-day

A third guide (video) will drop shortly after this post: (we'll link it here when it becomes available)

## We've Spent the Past Few Days Making the Process As Smooth As Possible

![image.png](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdF9Sm7X67yWznFmTuVAVPmkoku4iW2NCbQYFUkW1ifbg/image.png)

We did our best to add as many V1 and V2 labels and links everywhere on the UI. We tested all the links and made sure they're pointing to the proper V1 and V2 locations. Also spent a few days putting together a number of guides to help anyone who might be confused.

If you read our tweet thread from yesterday, then you also saw that we chose a time to launch today when as many team members would be online as possible. This is to handle any technical issues that might arise and also any support questions.

Our goal today is to not only migrate from V1 to V2, but test our newly expanded team and our ability to deliver our smoothest launch yet. 

We had a launch checklist today and checked it twice. Ensuring all the right pieces were in order. This is how we are approaching launches in the future and our aim is - as it always has been - continuous evolution and improvement in all of our procesees. 

## Questions, Concerns, Issues?

Please reach out. Listed in order, these are the best ways to get quick support:
1. Discord
2. Comment beneath this post
3. Telegram
4. Tweet @financeleo

 
https://images.hive.blog/DQmVsxUBNSEttko3J3d7LDXL9BWGYLXLXAs798Z1EPjeUdf/image.png
 

LeoFinance is a blockchain-based social media community that builds innovative applications on the Hive, BSC and ETH blockchains. Our flagship application: [LeoFinance.io](https://leofinance.io) allows users and creators to engage and share content on the blockchain while earning cryptocurrency rewards.

|        DeFi Platform           |           Tokenized Blogging               |          Track Hive Data          |
|:---------------------------------:    |:-----------------------------------:    |:-----------------------------------:    |

|          Native DEX              |        Wrapped LEO (ETH)           |       Hive Node         |
|:-----------------------------------:    |:-------------------------------:    |:-------------------------------:    |
| [LeoDex](https://leodex.io)     | [wLEO On Uniswap](https://wleo.io/uniswap) | [Witness Vote](https://hivesigner.com/sign/account-witness-vote?witness=leofinance&approve=1)

We Use this to Claim Accounts and Delegate RCs to Newly Onboarded Users + Daily LEO Payouts to Delegators**</sub></center>
